description.p: GNOME Calculator is an application that solves mathematical equations. Though it at first appears to be a simple calculator with only basic arithmetic operations, you can switch into Advanced, Financial, or Programming mode to find a surprising set of capabilities.

description.p: Overview of changes in gnome-calculator 3.32.1

ul.li: Removed copy icon from search provider result #103 (Robert Roth)
Do not assume octal base for binary numbers #101 (Robert Roth)
Use currency name instead of display name for conversion #106 (Robert Roth)
Updated application icon in help (Andre Klapper)
Fixed search provider results broken #104 (Pascal Nowack)
Ignore keypresses while calculating result #47 (Robert Roth)
Only allow entering one decimal point #5 (Robert Roth)
Use meson build compatible with older meson (Robert Roth)
Show thousands separator in unit converter #102 (Robert Roth)

description.p: Overview of changes in gnome-calculator 3.32.0
Overview of changes in gnome-calculator 3.31.92
Overview of changes in gnome-calculator 3.31.91

ul.li: Additional syntax for unit conversion (Tuomas Mikkola)

description.p: Overview of changes in gnome-calculator 3.31.90

ul.li: Exchange rate update interval preference #58 (Robert Roth)
Fix for digit transformed into ^ on double * #91 (Robert Roth)
Accept comma and decimal point as decimal separator #86 (Robert Roth)

description.p: Overview of changes in gnome-calculator 3.30.1:

ul.li: Fix opening multiple windows in GNOME Shell (Florian M├╝llner)
